meanings.definition: A collection of myths, especially one belonging to a particular religious or cultural tradition.
meanings.sent1: In our family, we enjoy reading about the mythology of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent2: Greek mythology is filled with fascinating stories of gods and heroes.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they created their own silly mythology about talking animals.
meanings.sent4: The mythology of the past serves as a window into the beliefs of our ancestors.
meanings.sent5: The mythology of different cultures can be both enchanting and educational.

meanings.sent1: Professor Smith teaches a course on mythology at the university.
meanings.sent2: Students interested in mythology often explore various ancient texts.
meanings.sent3: The researchers dove deep into the world of mythology to uncover hidden meanings.
meanings.sent4: Studying mythology is like unraveling a complex puzzle of human imagination.
meanings.sent5: The library's collection of books on mythology is extensive and informative.
